citation.article-title: Paenibacillus sophorae sp. nov., a nitrogen-fixing species isolated from the rhizosphere of Sophora japonica
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus sophorae sp. nov.
Paenibacillus sophorae (so.pho′ra.e. N.L. gen. n. sophorae of Sophora, referring to the plant Sophora japonica, the source of the rhizosphere soil from which the type strain was isolated).
Cell are Gram-stain-positive, facultatively anaerobic, motile, straight rods, measuring 0.6–1.5 µm×1.5–3 µm.
Ellipsoidal spores are located centrally in swollen sporangia.
Colonies on LD medium are circular, convex, white and glossy with entire margins after 72 h of incubation at 30 °C; usually they are 1–2 mm in diameter.
The temperature range for growth is 15–50 °C, with optimal growth at 30 °C.
The pH range for growth is 4–8 (optimum pH 6.0).
Unable to tolerate 3 % (w/v) NaCl.
Growth is inhibited by 0.001 % (w/v) lysozyme.
Catalase- and oxidase-negative.
Negative for the Voges–Proskauer reaction.
Nitrate can be reduced to nitrite.
Nitrogen is fixed.

The following substrates are utilized for growth and acid production: maltose, d-xylose, sodium citrate, d-glucose, lactose, d-sorbitol, raffinose, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, glycogen, mannitol, trehalose, cellobiose, d-galactose, l-sorbose and d-mannose.
Acid is not produced from sucrose, sodium succinate, d-fructose, glycerol, l-aspartate, l-arabinose, sodium dl-malate, d-ribose, inositol, dl-malic acid, inulin or creatine.
Cannot hydrolyse casein, starch or gelatin.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 46.0 mol% (thermal denaturation method).
The cell wall contains meso-diaminopimelic acid.
The predominant menaquinone is MK-7.
The major fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0 and iso-C16 : 0.
Sensitive to ampicillin (100 µg ml−1), kanamycin (50 µg ml−1), streptomycin (40 µg ml−1), tetracycline (12.5 µg ml−1) and chloromycetin (30 µg ml−1) but resistant to spectinomycin (100 µg ml−1).
The type strain, S27T ( = CGMCC 1.10238T = DSM 23020T), was isolated from rhizosphere soil of Sophora japonica planted in Beijing, China.
